page.title: 08KINGSTON SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: The activities of the village revolve around The Barn, which is an old flint tithe barn given by the incumbent of the parish some years ago, together with an adjoining playing field, for general use and enjoyment of the village. Local organisations using the Barn regularly: Wives Club, Senior Club, Mothers Union, Village Society, Model Engineering, Parochial Church and Parish Councils, Badminton, Indoor Bowls and a Playschool (held thrice weekly). Other events include Whist Drives, annual Harvest Supper, Flower and Photographic Exhibitions and all elections. In the playing field are swings, climbing frame, see-saw and a rocking horse, all of which are much used by the younger children. Also during the winter season, a Youth Football team plays on the nearby pitch.
